New Records: Finn Allen equaled the record of 16 sixes in an inning previously held only by Afghanistan's Hazratullah Zazai.
Finn Allen broke Brendon Mcullum's record of the highest individual score in a T20I inning by a Kiwi batter.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen scored 137 runs in only 62 deliveries, including 16 sixes and 5 boundaries.
Pakistan only managed to put 179 runs on the board and eventually went on to lose the match by 45 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand entered the match without the services of Kane Williamson who got injured in the last match and was ruled out of the series.
Mitchell Santner will be taking the captaincy series in the remainder of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: Fans from around the world enjoyed the spectacle put on by Finn Allen with his monstrous hitting and expressed their views on it on social media.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Allen also smashed Pakistan's speedster Haris Rauf for 27 runs in an over who ended with a figure of 4-0-60-2 in the match.
Others: With this victory, New Zealand has taken an unassailable lead of 3-0 in the series.
Pakistan won the toss and once more opted to field first in the third Twenty20 international against New Zealand.
